text: go to {object_location}\ntake {object_name} from {object_location}\nexamine {object_name}

Go to the fridge 1 and open it.
Take the {item_name} from the fridge 1.

Cool the {item_name} using the fridge 1.
Put the {item_name} in/on the countertop 1.

Given that you need to examine an object with a light source, this workflow describes the process.
go to {object_location}\nuse {light_source} at {object_location}
go to {object_location}\nexamine {object_name} using desklamp {desklamp_number}\nturn on desklamp {desklamp_number}
go to {desklamp_location}\nuse desklamp 1\nexamine {object}
examine desk {desk_number}\ntake {item} from desk {desk_number} for {i} times
examine bowl 1\nput bowl 1 in/on desk {desk_number}

Given that you need to examine an object with a desklamp, this workflow involves finding the desklamp and using it to examine the object.
go to {location_of_desklamp}\nuse desklamp

go to {desk_with_desklamp}
use {desklamp}

go to {desk_with_mug}
examine {mug}
go to desk 2\nexamine pencil 3 with desklamp 1
put pencil 3 in/on desk 2\nput pencil 3 in/on desk 1

Given that the task is to find the programming language paradigms of given languages, this workflow extracts the relevant paradigms.
[step 1: Find the language paradigms for the given entities]
Find the [computer.programming_language.language_paradigms] for {entity1}.
[step 2: Find the language paradigms for the second entity]
Find the [computer.programming_language.language_paradigms] for {entity2}.

Given that the task involves finding influences on programming languages, this workflow identifies the paradigms influenced by the given languages.
[step 1: Find the influences of the first entity]
Find the [computer.programming_language.influenced_by] for {entity1}.
[step 2: Find the influences of the second entity]
Find the [computer.programming_language.influenced_by] for {entity2}.

Given that the task is to gather information about variable stars, this workflow extracts relevant observations.
[step 1 description with {variable} placeholders]
Observe the categories and subcategories related to {variable}.
[step 2 description with {variable} placeholders]
Observe the specific instances of {variable} and their associated attributes.

Given that the task is to gather information about variable stars, this workflow filters out the relevant observations.
[step 1 description with {variable} placeholders]
Filter the observations to include only those related to {variable}.
[step 2 description with {variable} placeholders]
Filter the observations to include only the attributes that are relevant to {variable}, such as distance, mass, magnitude, and temperature.

Given that the task is to find the number of automotive classes for specific models, this workflow extracts the relevant automotive classes.
[step 1: find automotive classes for a given model] Find the automotive classes that the model belongs to using the relation `automotive.model.automotive_class`.
[step 2: count the classes] Count the number of unique automotive classes found for the model.

Given that the task involves counting instances of a specific automotive class, this workflow counts how many models belong to a given class.
[step 1: find related models] Find the models that are related to the given automotive class using the relation `automotive.model.related_models`.
[step 2: count the models] Count the number of unique models found in the relation.

Given that the task is to find the standard time zones for a location, this workflow retrieves the relevant time zones.
[step 1 description: Retrieve the location entity]
{location_entity}
[step 2 description: Get the time zones associated with the location]
get_relations({location_entity}, time_zones)

Given that the task involves finding the time zone of a location near an airport, this workflow first finds the location near the airport and then retrieves its time zone.
[step 1 description: Retrieve the airport entity]
{airport_entity}
[step 2 description: Find the location near the airport]
get_relations({airport_entity}, nearby_airports)
[step 3 description: Get the time zones associated with the nearest location]
get_relations({nearest_location}, time_zones)

Given that the user is querying about Olympic events in specific Olympics, this workflow extracts relevant events.
[step 1: Find Olympic Games] Find the Olympic Games instance related to the given year {year}.
[step 2: Extract Events] Extract the events that were officially contested in the specified Olympic Games.

Given that the user is interested in events from a specific Olympic Games, this workflow filters out the relevant events.
[step 1: Identify Olympic Games] Identify the Olympic Games instance for the year {year}.
[step 2: Filter Events] Filter the events to include only those that were officially contested in the identified Olympic Games.

Given that we need to extract ISO settings for a camera, this workflow identifies and lists the ISO settings.
[step 1 description: Identify the camera entity]
camera = {camera_entity}
[step 2 description: Retrieve the ISO settings for the camera]
isos = tool.call('get_camera_iso_settings', camera=camera)

Given that we need to count the number of ISO settings for a camera, this workflow counts the ISO settings.
[step 1 description: Identify the camera entity]
camera = {camera_entity}
[step 2 description: Retrieve and count the ISO settings for the camera]
isos_count = len(tool.call('get_camera_iso_settings', camera=camera))

Given that the task is to find the number of religious practices associated with specific religions, this workflow extracts and counts the practices.
[step 1 description with {religion1} and {religion2} placeholders]
1. Use the tool to find instances of `religion.religious_practice` that are associated with {religion1}.
[step 2 description with {religion1_practices} placeholder]
2. Use the tool to find instances of `religion.religious_practice` that are associated with {religion2}.
[step 3 description with {total_practices} placeholder]
3. Combine the results from steps 1 and 2 to get the total number of unique religious practices, assign it to {total_practices}.

Given that the task is to count the number of religious practices associated with specific religions, this workflow counts the practices.
[step 1 description with {religion1_practices} and {religion2_practices} placeholders]
1. Count the number of instances of `religion.religious_practice` associated with {religion1}, assign it to {religion1_practices}.
[step 2 description with {total_practices} placeholder]
2. Count the number of instances of `religion.religious_practice` associated with {religion2}, add it to {religion1_practices} to get the total number of unique religious practices, assign it to {total_practices}.

Given that the user is asking for information about a specific disease and its related entities, this workflow extracts and organizes the relevant details.
[step 1: Identify the disease] Identify the disease from the given entities. Let disease be {disease}.
[step 2: Retrieve disease information] Retrieve the treatments, symptoms, diagnosis, pets affected, causes, and risk factors for the disease. Let this information be {disease_info}.
[step 3: Identify related symptoms] Identify and list the symptoms associated with the disease. Let these symptoms be {symptoms}.

Given that the user is interested in the risk factors for a specific disease, this workflow focuses on extracting and organizing the risk factors.
[step 1: Identify the disease] Identify the disease from the given entities. Let disease be {disease}.
[step 2: Retrieve risk factors] Retrieve the risk factors associated with the disease. Let these risk factors be {risk_factors}.

Given that we need to find children of a specific character born in a particular location, this workflow helps in identifying the children born in a given place.
[step 1 description with {character} placeholder] Identify the character of interest, {character}.
[step 2 description with {location} placeholder] Retrieve the list of children of {character} and filter those born in {location}.
[step 3 description with {location} placeholder] Count the number of children born in {location}.

Given that we need to filter a list of children based on their birthplace, this workflow helps in filtering the children born in a specific location.
[step 1 description with {children_list} and {location} placeholders] Obtain the list of children, {children_list}.
[step 2 description with {location} placeholder] Filter the list to include only those children born in {location}.

Given that the task is to find the producer and content of a radio program, this workflow extracts the relevant information.
[step 1: find producers] Find the producers of the radio program by querying the producer entity.
[step 2: find content] Find the content produced by the producers by querying the content entity.

Given that the task is to find the location and affiliations of a radio station, this workflow extracts the relevant information.
[step 1: find location] Find the location of the radio station by querying the location entity.
[step 2: find affiliations] Find the affiliations of the radio station by querying the affiliations entity.

Given that the task is to determine the number of types of a blended whisky, this workflow extracts the relevant information.
[step 1 description: Identify the blended spirits] Identify the blended spirits by observing the entities and tools used. In this case, the blended spirits are instances of distilled_spirits.blended_spirit.
[step 2 description: Count the types] Count the number of types of the blended spirits. This can be done by observing the number of instances identified in the previous step.

Given that the task is to determine the number of types of a blended whisky, this workflow extracts the number of types.
[step 1 description: Identify the number of blended spirits] Identify the number of blended spirits by observing the tool output which provides a number.
[step 2 description: Confirm the count] Confirm the count of the types of blended spirits by cross-referencing with the identified blended spirits.

Given that we need to find a musical release by its producer and label, this workflow helps in identifying the specific release.
[step 1 find producer's releases] Find all releases produced by {producer} using the tool `get_relations` with the relation `music.recording.producer`.
[step 2 filter by label] From the list of releases, filter those that are released by {label} using the tool `intersection` with the relation `music.recording.releases`.

Given that the task is to find common symptoms between two diseases, this workflow extracts and compares symptoms.
[step 1 description with {disease1} and {disease2} placeholders]
- Extract symptoms for {disease1} using the tool `get_relations` with the relation `base.pethealth.pet_disease_or_medical_condition.symptoms`.
- Extract symptoms for {disease2} using the tool `get_relations` with the relation `base.pethealth.pet_disease_or_medical_condition.symptoms`.

[step 2 description with {symptoms1} and {symptoms2} placeholders]
- Find the intersection of {symptoms1} and {symptoms2} using the tool `intersection` to identify common symptoms.
- Return the list of common symptoms.

Given that we need to find religious texts that include both Buddhism and Buddhist texts, this workflow filters the texts based on inclusion.
[step 1 description: Identify the religious texts that include Buddhism]
texts_including_buddhism = tool.call("get_relations", variable #0, "religion.religion.includes", "Buddhism")
[step 2 description: Identify the religious texts that include Buddhist texts]
texts_including_buddhist_texts = tool.call("get_relations", variable #1, "religion.religion.includes", "buddhists")

Given that we have identified the religious texts that include both Buddhism and Buddhist texts, this workflow counts the number of common texts.
[step 1 description: Find the intersection of the two sets of texts]
common_texts = set(texts_including_buddhism).intersection(set(texts_including_buddhist_texts))
[step 2 description: Count the number of common texts]
number_of_common_texts = len(common_texts)

Find dishes that contain {ingredient} using the relation [dining.cuisine.ingredients]. Filter the found dishes to include only those that are part of {cuisine} using the relation [dining.cuisine.dishes].
Find ingredients that are part of {cuisine} using the relation [food.ingredient.cuisine]. Filter the found ingredients to include only {ingredient} using the relation [food.ingredient.dishes].

Given that the task is to find the viewfinder type of a specific camera, this workflow extracts the viewfinder type from the camera's details.
[step 1: Identify the camera] Identify the camera entity, which is an instance of digicams.digital_camera.
[step 2: Retrieve viewfinder type] Retrieve the viewfinder type of the camera, which is an instance of digicams.camera_viewfinder_type.

Given that the task is to find the manufacturer of the camera sensor, this workflow extracts the sensor manufacturer from the camera's details.
[step 1: Identify the camera] Identify the camera entity, which is an instance of digicams.digital_camera.
[step 2: Retrieve sensor manufacturer] Retrieve the manufacturer of the camera sensor, which is an instance of digicams.camera_sensor_manufacturer.

Given that we need to count the number of websites owned by a specific entity, this workflow provides a reusable method to achieve this.
[step 1 description: Identify the entity that owns the websites, using {entity_name} as the placeholder for the entity's name]
[step 2 description: Use the tool to observe the relationships related to website ownership, specifically focusing on the websites owned by {entity_name}]

Given that we need to filter and count specific instances of websites, this workflow offers a reusable approach.
[step 1 description: Filter the observed instances to find those that are websites, using {website_instances} as the placeholder for the filtered instances]
[step 2 description: Count the number of filtered websites, using {number_of_websites} as the placeholder for the count]

Given that we need to find the religious texts associated with specific religious groups, this workflow extracts and counts the texts.
[step 1: Identify the religious groups] Identify the religious groups by their unique identifiers: {group1} and {group2}.
[step 2: Retrieve religious texts] Use the get_relations tool to find the religious texts associated with {group1} and {group2}. The tool should be called with {group1} and {group2} as parameters to retrieve the texts.
[step 3: Count the texts] Count the number of unique religious texts retrieved for each group and return the total count of texts across both groups.

Given that the task is to find the number of adherents and practices for mormonites and eastern christians, this workflow extracts relevant relations.
[step 1 description: Retrieve all relations related to the number of adherents and practices for the given entities]
relations = get_relations(entities=[mormonites, eastern christians], relation_types=[religion.religion.number_of_adherents, religion.religion.practices])

[step 2 description: Filter the relations to only include those that are instances of religion.religious_practice]
religious_practices = filter_relations(relations, relation_type=religion.religious_practice)

Given that the task is to find the number of adherents and practices for mormonites and eastern christians, this workflow counts the adherents and practices.
[step 1 description: Count the number of adherents for each entity]
adherents_mormonites = count_adherents(entity=mormonites, relations=relations)
adherents_eastern_christians = count_adherents(entity=eastern christians, relations=relations)

[step 2 description: Count the number of religious practices for each entity]
practices_mormonites = count_practices(entity=mormonites, relations=religious_practices)
practices_eastern_christians = count_practices(entity=eastern christians, relations=religious_practices)
Find the designer of the ride named {mansion_name}. Find all rides designed by {designer_name}.
Find the designer of the ride named {mansion_name}. Find all rides designed by {designer_name}. Among the rides designed by {designer_name}, find the one with the highest {max_speed}.

Given that we need to find rockets from the same manufacturer as a given rocket, this workflow identifies rockets manufactured by the same manufacturer.
[step 1 description: Find the given rocket entity] {given_rocket_entity}
[step 2 description: Retrieve the manufacturer of the given rocket] {given_rocket_entity}.manufacturer
[step 3 description: Find rockets manufactured by the same manufacturer] {given_rocket_entity}.manufacturer.rockets_manufactured

Given that the task is to find key designers for a specific computer model, this workflow extracts the designers.
[step 1: Identify the computer model] Identify the computer model from the given entities, denoted as {computer_model}.
[step 2: Retrieve key designers] Use the tool to retrieve the key designers for the identified computer model, denoted as {key_designers}.

Given that the task involves matching specific computer models, this workflow ensures the correct models are identified.
[step 1: Identify model instances] Identify the instances of computer.computer that match the given entities, denoted as {model_instances}.
[step 2: Verify parent model] Verify if the identified model instances have a parent model that matches the given entities, denoted as {parent_model}.

Given that the task is to find the ISO capabilities of two digital cameras, this workflow extracts the ISO settings for each camera.
[step 1 description with {camera_entity} placeholder]
- Retrieve the ISO settings for the camera entity {camera_entity}.
[step 2 description with {camera_entity} placeholder]
- Extract the list of ISO capabilities for the camera entity {camera_entity}.

Given that we have the ISO capabilities for two cameras, this workflow compares the number of ISO settings between the two.
[step 1 description with {camera1_entity} and {camera2_entity} placeholders]
- Retrieve the ISO settings for the first camera entity {camera1_entity}.
- Retrieve the ISO settings for the second camera entity {camera2_entity}.
[step 2 description with {camera1_entity} and {camera2_entity} placeholders]
- Compare the number of ISO settings between the first camera entity {camera1_entity} and the second camera entity {camera2_entity}.
Identify the fictional character {character}. Retrieve the list of {character}'s children and filter those who were born in {location}.
Use the list of {filtered_children} obtained from the filter_children_by_location workflow. Count the number of elements in the list {filtered_children} to get the count {count}.
